Package test

Class Ball

java.lang.Object
test.Ball
Direct Known Subclasses:
RubberBall
public abstract class Ball
extends java.lang.Object
This is the class used to represent the ball object in the Brick Game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Ball

      public Ball​(java.awt.geom.Point2D center, int radius, java.awt.Color inner, java.awt.Color border)
      This is the constructor for the Ball Object to represent the ball. The 4 coordinates of the edges of the ball are assigned here (up, down, left and right). The face of the ball is set here. The color (inner and border) of the ball is set here. Refactoring - The original code consisted of passing in two radii (radiusA and radiusB) for the makeBall method, however this is redundant and makes the code harder to understand. I have refactored the code by creating one single parameter called 'radius'. This performs the same functionality as the the ball will be having one radius only. A new method "getSpeedsXY" has been added so that this method can be called whenever the ball speed has to re-allocated randomly in any Class rather than repeating the same lines of code as we saw in the original.
      Parameters:
      center - Point2D type, center holds the x and y coordinate of the ball's center.
      radius - Integer type, radiusA holds the radius of the ball.
      inner - Color type, inner holds the ball's inside color.
      border - Color type, border holds the ball's outside color.

  • Method Details

    • makeBall

      protected abstract java.awt.Shape makeBall​(java.awt.geom.Point2D center, int radius)
      Abstract class to make the Shape of the ball (Circle).
      Parameters:
      center - Point2D type, consists of the x, y coordinate of the center of the ball.
      radius - Int type, radius of ball.
      Returns:
      Returns type Shape of of a ball.

    • move

      public void move()
      This method is focused on having the ball move freely as the game begins.

    • setSpeed

      public void setSpeed​(int x, int y)
      This method is used to set the speed of the ball along both axes.
      Parameters:
      x - The speed at which the ball moves along the x-axis.
      y - The speed at which the ball moves along the y-axis.

    • setXSpeed

      public void setXSpeed​(int s)
      This method is used to set the speed of the ball along the x axis only.
      Parameters:
      s - The speed at which the ball moves along the x-axis.

    • setYSpeed

      public void setYSpeed​(int s)
      This method is used to set the speed of the ball along the y axis only.
      Parameters:
      s - The speed at which the ball moves along the y-axis.

      public void moveTo​(java.awt.Point p)
      This method is used to move the ball back to the spawn point after ball is lost or when new level is begun.
      Parameters:
      p - The Point is the location we want the ball to be spawned from on reset.

    • setPoints

      private void setPoints​(double width, double height)
      This method is used to set the up, down, left, right edges of the ball with the passed in width and height.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the rectangle frame of the ball.
      height - The height of the rectangle frame of the ball.

    • getSpeedsXY

      public int[] getSpeedsXY()
      This method is used to generate two speeds for X and Y axes respectively.
      Returns:
      Returns an Int array where the zeroth index refers to speedX and first index refers to speedY.
